page.title: 04LAND DRAINAGE
page.content: { The G.L.C. Land Drainage and {Engineering Department}has been in New Malden since 1937; before 1964 it belonged to Surrey County Council. 16 men work at the department; the job has not attracted any girls. The men work a 5 day week from 7am-4pm; they work in two gangs. Each gang covers the area from Streatham to Barnes which includes the Rivers Beverley and Wandle. Grass cutting equipment and drags are used to keep the rivers and sewers clean. In areas where gas iss expected breathing equipment is used. There have never been any strikes at the department because the men are strongly against them. The men are not yet sure whether or not they will lose their jobs when the G.L.C. is abolished.
